snippet: Testimony from the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff raises questions about U.S. policy on fighting ISIS only a week after President Obama explained it.
abstract: Editorial contends Gen Martin Dempsey's comments about possibility of sending American troops to fight Islamic State militants is a reversal of firm commitment Pres Obama made not to immerse country in ground war; maintains alarming uncertainty Dempsey has injected into evolving military strategy makes it even more important that Congress debate and vote on new mission in Iraq and Syria.
lead_paragraph: Testimony from the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff raises questions about U.S. policy on fighting ISIS only a week after President Obama explained it.

headline.seo: Is U.S. Policy on Fighting ISIS Already Changing?

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
